TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed Modifiability extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the modifiability value of a for a binary XAML (BAML) class or class member.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.LocalizabilityAttribute> attribute can be applied to a class, property, or method.
For more information on how to use localization attributes, see [Localization Attributes and Comments](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/localization-attributes-and-comments.md).
## Examples The following code example shows the modifiability value of localization attributes defined for a button.
[!code-xml[AttributesSnippets#AttributesSnippet1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/AttributesSnippets/CSharp/Attributes.xaml#attributessnippet1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Modifiability Inherit = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Targeted value modifiability is inherited from its parent node.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Modifiability Modifiable = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Targeted value is modifiable by localizers.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Modifiability Unmodifiable = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Targeted value is not modifiable by localizers.
